array.string: The first African American regiment, leaves Boston, to fight for the Union.
Fort Pillow massacre : African American soldiers who had surrendered at Fort Pillow are killed
Union forces enter Atlanta, Georgia a day after the Confederate defenders flee the city.
Confederate General Robert E. Lee becomes general-in-chief.
Five Forks: In Petersburg, Virginia, Confederate General Lee begins his final offensive.
Union forces capture Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America.
At Appomattox, Virginia, Confederate General Lee surrenders his 28,000 troops to the Union.
Abraham Lincoln is shot by John Wilkes Booth.
Last battle of the Civil War
Palmito Ranch South Texas: the last battle of the Civil War ends with a Confederate victory.
President Andrew Johnson officially declares the American Civil War to be ended.
